intro: Rosa andrzejowscii, commonly known as the Andrzejowksi rose, is a species native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central Europe. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to rocky and woodland soils, thriving in partial shade to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
